phrases.usage: Use this to indicate a preference for a more affordable option when considering your budget.
phrases.example: I prefer something cheaper because I want to stay within my monthly budget.

phrases.usage: Use this to emphasize that the durability or standard of a product is a priority for you.
phrases.example: Quality matters to me so I am willing to invest in a premium brand.

phrases.text: I think this one is better because...
phrases.usage: Use this to provide a logical justification for choosing one product over another.
phrases.example: I think this one is better because it offers more features for a similar price.

phrases.usage: Use this to identify the primary factor influencing your purchasing decision.
phrases.example: What matters most is reliability because I need this equipment for daily professional tasks.

phrases.usage: Use this to contrast specific features or benefits between two different items.
phrases.example: Compared to this one, the other model consumes less energy so it is more efficient.

phrases.text: Could you show me another option?
phrases.usage: Use this to request an alternative choice if the current selection does not meet your requirements.
phrases.example: Could you show me another option because this style does not match my office decor?

phrases.usage: Use this to confirm your final decision and proceed with the purchase.
phrases.example: Okay, I'll take this one because it satisfies all my technical requirements.

keyVocabulary.definition: A plan for how much money will be spent.
Able to last a long time without breaking.
A distinct attribute or aspect of a product.
The ability to function well without wasting energy or time.
Something that is needed or must be done.
